message: Does anyone have a working config for vim/tmux, so that you can resize vim windows (hsplit/vsplit/nerdtree/etc) with the mouse? I can use the mouse to select text, but not resize anything.
yeah, pretty much where I thought things were. Ah well! at least tmux is actively being developed; maybe it'll support this eventually.

If you have ttymouse=xterm in your vimrc you can do visual mode stuff in vim and click through nerdtree. You can do a tmux selection by holding shift while clicking. But as far as drag to resize is concerned you are out of luck in tmux land at this point. If you use screen you can set tyymouse=xterm2 in your vimrc and you're good to go except no screen vertical split unless you've got a patched copy of screen.
